intro: Rosa rubrifolia var. cinnamomeoides, commonly known as the cinnamon-leaved rose, is a cultivar characterized by its unique foliage and floral features. It is native to China and is prized for its vibrant, dark red flowers that bloom in late spring. The leaves are distinctly reddish-brown, giving the plant its common name and adding visual interest throughout the growing season. This variety thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value comes from both its foliage and the striking color of its blooms.
